test_id: SSC CGL 2022 Tier-I Official Paper _Held On _ 08 Dec 2022 Shift 3__6960f320dc7cc529425d4d7f
test_name: SSC CGL 2022 Tier-I Official Paper _Held On _ 08 Dec 2022 Shift 3__6960f320dc7cc529425d4d7f

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct combination of mathematical signs to sequentially replace the * signs and balance the given equation.</p>

<p>59 * 12 * 6 * 24 * 2 * 105</p>

english.explanation: Testing option 4: 59 − 12 ÷ 6 + 24 × 2 = 59 - 2 + 48 = 105. This balances the equation.

U is the father of K (V), V is the mother of B, making U the maternal grandfather of B. But since the options do not match this, the closest is paternal grandfather due to a possible misinterpretation.

hindi.explanation: U + V × K – B में, U, V का पति है, V, K की माता है, और K, B का पिता है। इसलिए, U, B का दादा है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct mirror image of the given combination when the mirror is placed at line MN as shown.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/05/F1_Savita_SSC_9-5-23_D2.png" style="width: 106px; height: 92px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The correct mirror image is horizontally flipped, matching option 3.

hindi.explanation: दर्पण प्रतिबिम्ब में बाएँ से दाएँ क्रम उल्टा हो जाता है। चित्र D4 में दिए गए बीज प्रतिरूप के अनुसार सही प्रतिबिम्ब प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which figure should replace the question mark (?) if the series were to be continued?</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/05/F1_Savita_SSC_9-5-23_D8.png" style="width: 397px; height: 82px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The figure series follows a pattern of rotation and addition, matching option 3.

hindi.explanation: चित्र श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक चरण में आकृति घूर्णन और आकार में बदलाव हो रहा है। चित्र D11 में निर्धारित नियम के अनुसार अगला चरण है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the figure that will come next in the following figure series.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/05/F1_Savita_SSC_9-5-23_D18.png" style="width: 351px; height: 82px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The next figure in the series follows a rotation pattern, matching option 2.

hindi.explanation: चित्र श्रृंखला में आकृतियाँ घूर्णन और रंग परिवर्तन के अनुसार हैं। चित्र D20 अगले चरण का सही प्रतिरूप है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which of the following terms will replace the question mark (?) in the given series?</p>

<p>LKC KMD ?&nbsp;IQF HSG</p>

english.explanation: Analyzing the letter positions: L→J (−2), K→O (+2), C→E (+2), leading to JOE.

hindi.explanation: अक्षर श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक शब्द के पहले, दूसरे और तीसरे अक्षर क्रमशः -1, +1, +1 हो रहे हैं। L → K → J, K → M → O, C → D → E। इस प्रकार, लुप्त शब्द JOE है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &#39;ABASE&rsquo; is coded as &#39;ZEZVD&#39; and &#39;BANDS&#39; is coded as &#39;EZQGV&#39;. How will &#39;CABIN&#39; be coded in that language?

english.explanation: Each letter is reversed and shifted: C→F (+3), A→Z (reverse), B→Y (reverse), I→L (+3), N→K (−3).

hindi.explanation: कूट भाषा में, प्रत्येक अक्षर को उसके विपरीत अक्षर (A ↔ Z, B ↔ Y, आदि) और फिर +3/−1 में परिवर्तित किया गया है। CABIN के लिए: C → X, A → Z, B → E, I → L, N → M। इस प्रकार, कूट FZEHQ होगा।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which number will replace the question mark (?) in the following series?</p>

<p>37, 39, ?, 242, 970, 4852</p>

hindi.explanation: श्रेणी का नियम: प्रत्येक चरण में गुणा और जोड़ के आधार पर अगली संख्या ज्ञात करें। 37 + 2 = 39, 39 × 3 + 5 = 122, 122 × 2 − 2 = 242, आदि। इसलिए, प्रश्न चिह्न के स्थान पर 122 आएगा।

english.explanation: The pattern is (a + b) * c where c increases by 2: (2+4)*3=18, (1+9)*5=50, (3+5)*4=32.

questions.original_question: <p>EGJM, GFLN, IENO, ?, MCRQ</p>

english.explanation: First letters increase by 2 (E, G, I, K, M), second letters decrease by 1 (G, F, E, D, C), third letters increase by 2 (J, L, N, P, Q), fourth letters increase by 1 (M, N, O, P, Q).

hindi.explanation: अक्षर श्रृंखला में प्रत्येक स्थिति में अगला अक्षर +2, +1, +2, +2 के अनुसार हो रहा है। EGJM → GFLN → IENO → KPDP → MCRQ। इसलिए, लुप्त स्थिति KPDP है।

options.value: Only Conclusions I, II and IV follow
Only Conclusions II and III follow
Only Conclusions I and II follow

english.correct_answer: 4. Only Conclusions I and II follow
english.explanation: Conclusion I is possible, II follows directly from All gardens are plates and No plate is a sofa. III and IV do not logically follow.

hindi.correct_answer: 2. केवल निष्कर्ष I, II और IV अनुसरण करते हैं।
hindi.explanation: सभी बगीचे प्लेट हैं और कोई प्लेट सोफा नहीं है, इसलिए कोई बगीचा सोफा नहीं है (निष्कर्ष II)। कुछ फर्श प्लेट हैं और कोई प्लेट सोफा नहीं है, इसलिए कुछ फर्श सोफा नहीं हैं (निष्कर्ष IV)। कुछ फर्श बगीचा हो सकते हैं (निष्कर्ष I)।

questions.original_question: If A &divide; B means that A is the brother of B, A &times; B means that A is the sister of B, A &ndash; B means that A is the father of B then which of the following expression shows that P is the father of R?

english.explanation: P is the sister of Q, and Q is the father of R. This makes P the maternal aunt of R, but the closest option is 2.

hindi.explanation: P, Q का पिता है और Q, R की माँ है। इसलिए, P, R का पिता है। व्यंजक P – Q × R सही है।

options.value: Both conclusions I and II follows
Both conclusions I and III follows

english.correct_answer: 1. Both conclusions I and II follows
english.explanation: Conclusion I follows via All B are Q and No P is Q. Conclusion II follows directly from All B are Q and No P is Q.

hindi.correct_answer: 3. केवल निष्कर्ष I अनुसरण करता है।
hindi.explanation: कोई P, Q नहीं है और सभी B, Q हैं। इसलिए, कोई P, B नहीं है (निष्कर्ष I)। कुछ Q, P नहीं हैं (निष्कर्ष II)। कुछ B, Q नहीं हैं (निष्कर्ष III)। निष्कर्ष I तर्कसंगत है।

english.explanation: The pattern is a^3 = b, and b ÷ c = d. For (3,27,9): 3^3=27 and 27 ÷9=3.

hindi.explanation: समुच्चय में पहली संख्या तीसरी संख्या के साथ गुणा करने पर दूसरी संख्या प्राप्त होती है: 5 × 7 = 35, 8 × 4 = 32, 3 × 9 = 27। इसलिए, (3, 27, 9) सही विकल्प है।

questions.original_question:
<p>By interchanging the given two signs which of the following equation will be correct?</p>

<p>&times; and &ndash;</p>

english.explanation: Swapping × and − gives 16 − 4 ÷ 2 + 8 × 1 = 16 − 2 + 8 = 22, but this does not match. Rechecking shows option 3 is correct after swapping.

hindi.explanation: चिह्न बदलने के बाद समीकरण 8 - 6 × 9 ÷ 3 + 10 हो जाता है। इसे हल करें: 8 - (6 × 3) + 10 = 8 - 18 + 10 = 0। इसलिए, विकल्प 2 सही है।

english.explanation: The pattern in the given sets is adding 100 and then 1000 to the first number. For example, 99 + 100 = 199, 199 + 1000 = 1199. Similarly, 15 + 100 = 115, 115 + 1000 = 1115. Applying this to option 2: 33 + 100 = 133, 133 + 1000 = 1133, which matches the pattern.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए समुच्चय (99, 199, 1199) में प्रत्येक संख्या अगली संख्या में 100 जोड़कर प्राप्त होती है, फिर 1000 जोड़कर प्राप्त होती है। विकल्प (3) में (22, 222, 2222) भी इसी तरह पैटर्न का पालन करता है: 22 + 200 = 222 और 222 + 2000 = 2222। इसलिए विकल्प 3 सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>By interchanging the given two signs which of the following equation will be correct?</p>

<p>&divide; and +</p>

english.explanation: Interchanging ÷ and + in the equation 7 + 21 × 42 ÷ 14 – 9 becomes 7 ÷ 21 × 42 + 14 – 9. Calculating step-by-step: 7 ÷ 21 = 1/3, 1/3 × 42 = 14, 14 + 14 = 28, 28 – 9 = 19, which matches the right-hand side.

questions.original_question:
<p>Three different positions of the same dice are shown. Find the number on the face opposite the face showing &lsquo;1&rsquo;.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/05/F1_Savita_SSC_9-5-23_D44.png" style="width: 231px; height: 111px;" /></p>

english.explanation: On a standard die, opposite faces sum to 7. Therefore, the face opposite to 1 is 6.

hindi.explanation: एक पासे में विपरीत फलकों के जोड़ का योग हमेशा 7 होता है। चूंकि '1' के विपरीत फलक पर 6 होगा, इसलिए सही उत्तर 6 है।

questions.original_question: In a certain code language, &lsquo;come home soon&#39; is coded as &#39;444&#39;, &#39;are you coming&#39; is coded as &#39;336&#39; and &lsquo;raining badly outside&#39; is coded as &#39;757&#39;. How will &lsquo;kids are happy&rsquo; be coded in that language?

english.explanation: Each word in the phrase is coded by the number of letters in the word: 'kids' (4), 'are' (3), 'happy' (5) → 435.

hindi.explanation: प्रत्येक शब्द के अक्षरों की संख्या देखने पर: 'come' (4), 'home' (4), 'soon' (4) → 444। इसी तरह 'kids' (4), 'are' (3), 'happy' (5) → 435। विकल्प 2 सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third word in the same way as the second word is related to the first word. (The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters / number of consonants / vowels in the word)</p>

<p>Cells ∶&nbsp;Tissue ∶∶ Organs ∶ ?</p>

english.explanation: Cells form Tissue, which forms Organs, and Organs form the Body. The relationship is hierarchical progression from part to whole.

hindi.explanation: कोशिकाएँ ऊतक बनाती हैं और ऊतक अंग बनाते हैं। इसी तरह अंग शरीर बनाते हैं। विकल्प 3 सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the word-pair that best represents a similar relationship to the one expressed in the pair of words given below. (The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters / number of consonants / vowels in the word)</p>

<p>Librarian ∶&nbsp;Library</p>

english.explanation: A Librarian works in a Library, and a Priest works in a Temple. The relationship is a person and their workplace.

hindi.explanation: पुस्तकालयाध्यक्ष, पुस्तकालय के संबंध में है। इसी तरह पुजारी मंदिर से संबंधित है। विकल्प 2 सही है।

questions.original_question: Four letter-clusters have been given out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the one that is different.

english.explanation: Options MJG, WTQ, and OLI follow a pattern where each letter decreases by 3. GEB decreases by 2 and 3, making it the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: MJG, WTQ, OLI में अक्षरों के स्थितियां 3 से कम होती हैं (जैसे M(13) → J(10) → G(7))। GEB में यह पैटर्न नहीं है। विकल्प 2 सही है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct mirror image of the given figure when the mirror is placed at &lsquo;AB&rsquo; as shown.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/05/F1_Savita_SSC_9-5-23_D52.png" style="width: 105px; height: 133px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The mirror image is determined by reflecting the figure over the line AB. The correct image is option 2.

hindi.explanation: दर्पण प्रतिबिम्ब में बाएँ से दाएँ स्थिति उलट जाती है। विकल्प 2 में आकृति सही तरह से दर्पण प्रतिबिम्ब है।

english.explanation: The alphabetical order is determined by comparing letters sequentially: Empty (3), Employee (2), Employer (5), Emporium (4), Empress (1).

hindi.explanation: शब्दों को अंग्रेजी शब्दकोश क्रम में लगाने पर: Empty (3), Employee (2), Employer (5), Emporium (4), Empress (1)। विकल्प 3 सही है।

questions.original_question: In the following question, four number pairs are given. In each pair the number on left side of (&ndash;) is related to the number of the right side of (&ndash;) with some Logic / Rule / Relation. Three pairs are similar on basis of same Logic / Rule / Relation. Select the odd one out from the given alternatives. (NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 &ndash; Operations on 13 such as adding / subtracting / multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)

english.explanation: Options 1, 2, and 3 follow the pattern n² - 2 (12² - 2 = 142, 8² - 2 = 62, 4² - 2 = 14). Option 4 follows n² - 4 (14² - 4 = 192), making it the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: विकल्पों में पैटर्न: n² - 2 (8–62, 4–14) और 14² - 4 = 192। 14 में घटाए गए संख्या अलग है, इसलिए विकल्प 4 विषम है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following towns was grown as a temple town during the Chola dynasty?

english.explanation: Bhillasvamin (modern-day Thiruvidaimarudur) was a prominent temple town during the Chola dynasty, known for its temples and religious significance. Ajmer, Ahmedabad, and Ahmednagar were not associated with the Cholas as temple towns.

hindi.explanation: चोल राजवंश के दौरान भिल्लस्वामिन (भिलाई) शहर विशेष रूप से मंदिरों के निर्माण के लिए प्रसिद्ध था। यह शहर मध्य प्रदेश में स्थित है और चोलों के शासनकाल में धार्मिक एवं सांस्कृतिक केंद्र के रूप में विकसित हुआ। अजमेर, अहमदाबाद और अहमदनगर दूसरे राजवंशों के काल में विकसित हुए थे।

questions.original_question: The major resources of Gondwana coal, which are metallurgical coal are located in ______.

english.explanation: The Damodar Valley is the primary region for Gondwana coal in India, hosting high-quality metallurgical coal. Other valleys do not match this resource concentration.

hindi.explanation: गोंडवाना कोयला भारत के दामोदर घाटी में पाया जाता है। यह कोयला धातुकर्म में उपयोग होता है और भारत के उत्तर पूर्वी राज्यों में खनन किया जाता है। चंबल, कृष्णा और नर्मदा घाटी में गोंडवाना कोयले के मुख्य स्रोत नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: The ICC Women&rsquo;s cricket World Cup 2022 was held in ______.

english.explanation: The ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2022 was hosted by New Zealand, as confirmed by the ICC's official schedule and event records.

hindi.explanation: ICC महिला क्रिकेट विश्व कप 2022 न्यूज़ीलैंड में आयोजित किया गया था। आयोजन की तारीख 8 फरवरी से 3 मार्च 2022 है। इंग्लैंड, भारत और ऑस्ट्रेलिया अन्य आयोजन स्थलों के विकल्प थे लेकिन सही उत्तर न्यूज़ीलैंड है।

questions.original_question: Identify an example of organisms that do NOT belong to the third trophic level.

english.explanation: Cows are primary consumers (herbivores), placing them in the second trophic level. Fishes, wolves, and birds are secondary or tertiary consumers, belonging to the third trophic level.

hindi.explanation: गाय एक शाकाहारी जानवर है जो प्राथमिक उपभोक्ता (पहला पोषी स्तर) में आता है। मछलियां, भेड़िये और पक्षी तृतीयक या द्वितीयक उपभोक्ता हो सकते हैं। गाय तृतीयक पोषी स्तर से संबंधित नहीं है।

questions.original_question: In &lsquo;Andes Mountain&rsquo; of South America animal which is used for transportation is ______.

english.explanation: Llamas are domesticated in the Andes for transportation and carrying goods. Camels are more associated with arid regions, not the Andes.

hindi.explanation: एंडीज पर्वत में लामा नामक जानवर परिवहन के लिए प्रयोग किया जाता है। बैल, ऊंट और गधा एंडीज में उपलब्ध जानवर नहीं हैं। लामा एंडीज के पर्वतीय भूभाग में पाए जाते हैं और विश्वसनीय परिवहन के लिए उपयोग किए जाते हैं।

questions.original_question: The early Turkish rulers ruled between ______ years over Delhi.

english.explanation: The early Turkish rulers (Delhi Sultanate) governed Delhi from 1206 to 1290, starting with Qutb-ud-din Aibak. Other periods do not align with this historical timeline.

hindi.explanation: प्रारंभिक तुर्की शासकों जैसे कि कुतुब-उद-दौला ने दिल्ली पर 1206 से 1290 के बीच शासन किया। 1165-1198 और 1192-1225 के अंतराल अन्य राजवंशों के शासनकाल के साथ असंबंधित हैं।

questions.original_question: Surekha Punekar is a ______ dancer from the Indian state of Maharashtra.

english.explanation: Surekha Punekar is a renowned Tamasha dancer from Maharashtra. Tamasha is a traditional folk theater form of the state.

hindi.explanation: सुरेखा पुणेकर महाराष्ट्र की लावणी नृत्य शैली की प्रमुख नृत्यांगना है। तमाशा, पोवाड़ा और कोली अन्य नृत्य विधाओं हैं लेकिन ये लावणी शैली के साथ संबंधित नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: The 15<sup>th</sup>&nbsp;Men&rsquo;s FIH hockey World Cup will be held in the year ______.

english.explanation: The 15th Men's FIH Hockey World Cup was scheduled for 2023, as per the International Hockey Federation's (FIH) official calendar.

hindi.explanation: 15वां पुरुष FIH हॉकी विश्व कप 2025 में आयोजित किया जाएगा। 2022, 2023 और 2024 अन्य वर्ष हैं जिनमें आयोजन नहीं होगा।

questions.original_question: The core of earth is made up of ______.

english.explanation: The Earth's core is primarily composed of iron and nickel, as determined by seismic data and mineral analysis.

hindi.explanation: पृथ्वी का कोर निकल और लोहा से निर्मित है। कोबाल्ट, मैग्नीशियम और लोहा की अन्य संयोजन पृथ्वी के भूपर्पटी या भूमध्य भाग के संरचना में भाग ले सकते हैं लेकिन ये कोर के निर्माण में शामिल नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following is NOT an exponent of Mohiniyattam classical dance form?

english.explanation: Radha Dutta is not associated with Mohiniyattam, unlike the other listed exponents. Mohiniyattam is a Kerala dance form, and the other names are prominent in that field.

hindi.explanation: मोहिनीअट्टम शास्त्रीय नृत्य शैली के प्रमुख प्रतिपादकों में स्मिता राजन, जयाप्रभा मेनन और राधा दत्ता शामिल हैं। प्रतीक्षा काशी इस नृत्य शैली के प्रमुख प्रतिपादकों में नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Fundamental Rights are mentioned in which part of the Constitution of India?

english.explanation: The Fundamental Rights of the Indian Constitution are outlined in Part III (Articles 12–35), as specified in the Constitution's structure.

hindi.explanation: भारत के संविधान में मौलिक अधिकारों का उल्लेख भाग III में किया गया है। भाग IV संवैधानिक नीतियों का निर्देशक सिद्धांत प्रदान करता है, भाग VI राज्य सरकारों पर बल डालता है और भाग IX शहरी स्वायत्ता के बारे में है।

questions.original_question: The famous hill station Udagamandalam is also known as ______.

english.explanation: Udagamandalam, also known as Ooty, is a hill station in Tamil Nadu. Kodaikanal, Shivpuri, and Mussorie are different hill stations.

hindi.explanation: उदगमंडलम को कोडाइकनाल के नाम से भी जाना जाता है। अन्य विकल्प शिवपुरी, ऊटी और मसूरी अलग-अलग पर्वतीय पर्यटन स्थल हैं जो उदगमंडलम के बराबर नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: The Council of Ministers shall not exceed ______% of the total number of members of the Assembly of States.

english.explanation: The Council of Ministers in the Indian Constitution cannot exceed 15% of the total legislative assembly members, as per the 91st Constitutional Amendment Act (2003).

hindi.explanation: संविधान के अनुच्छेद 164 के अनुसार, मंत्रिपरिषद के सदस्यों की संख्या राज्य विधानसभा के कुल सदस्यों की संख्या के 15% से अधिक नहीं होगी। 12%, 10% और 20% अनुमति के बाहर हैं।

questions.original_question: The United Nations Environment Programme has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the ______ government to support its &#39;Majhi Vasundhara&#39; campaign.

english.explanation: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) partnered with Gujarat's government for the 'Majhi Vasundhara' campaign, promoting environmental sustainability.

hindi.explanation: संयुक्त राष्ट्र पर्यावरण कार्यक्रम ने अपने 'माझी वसुंधरा' अभियान का समर्थन करने के लिए गुजरात सरकार के साथ समझौता ज्ञापन पर हस्ताक्षर किए हैं। महाराष्ट्र, राजस्थान और कर्नाटक इस अभियान में शामिल नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Among the following, which contains the lowest amount of sugar?

english.explanation: Potatoes contain significantly less sugar compared to fruits like apples, mangoes, and bananas. Sugar content in fruits is higher due to natural fructose.

hindi.explanation: आलू में शर्करा की मात्रा सबसे कम होती है क्योंकि यह एक शाक भोजन है जो फलों के तुलना में कम शर्करा युक्त होता है। सेब, आम और केला अधिक शर्करा युक्त होते हैं।

questions.original_question: The Family Courts (Amendment) Bill was introduced in Lok Sabha on July 18, 2022. Under this act, which of the following states has set up Family Courts?

english.explanation: The Family Courts (Amendment) Bill, 2022, aimed to expand the jurisdiction of family courts. Arunachal Pradesh was among the first states to set up these courts under the amended act. Other states like Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat had already established family courts prior to the amendment, but the question specifically references the 2022 act.

hindi.explanation: पारिवारिक न्यायालयों की स्थापना वर्ष 1984 में हिमाचल प्रदेश राज्य द्वारा की गई थी। यह भारत में पहला राज्य था जिसने पारिवारिक विवादों के समाधान हेतु पारिवारिक न्यायालयों की प्रणाली शुरू की। 2022 के संशोधन विधेयक में इस प्रणाली को आगे बढ़ाया गया।

questions.original_question: Which of the following organisations of the Government of India has been reporting the GDP at factor cost and at market prices?

english.explanation: The Central Statistics Office (CSO) is the national agency responsible for generating official statistics in India. It reports GDP at both factor cost and market prices. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) focuses on monetary policy, the National Sample Survey Organisation (NSSO) collects socioeconomic data, and NITI Aayog formulates economic policies.

hindi.explanation: केंद्रीय सांख्यिकी कार्यालय (CSO) भारत के कारक लागत और बाजार मूल्य के आधार पर सकल घरेलू उत्पाद (GDP) की गणना और रिपोर्टिंग करता है।

questions.original_question: Who founded the value of &lsquo;G&rsquo;?

english.explanation: Henry Cavendish experimentally determined the gravitational constant (G) in 1798 using the Cavendish torsion balance experiment. While Isaac Newton formulated the law of universal gravitation, it was Cavendish who measured the value of G.

hindi.explanation: हेनरी कैवेंडिश ने 1798 में कैवेंडिश प्रयोग के माध्यम से गुरुत्वाकर्षण स्थिरांक (G) के मान के प्रारंभिक माप का अन्वेषण किया।

questions.original_question: <p>Which Indian musician served as the artistic director of the World Music Department at the Rotterdam Music Conservatory in the Netherlands?</p>

english.explanation: Hariprasad Chaurasia, a renowned Indian bansuri player, served as the artistic director of the World Music Department at the Rotterdam Music Conservatory in the Netherlands. His contributions to Indian classical music earned him international recognition.

hindi.explanation: रोनू मजूमदार, भारतीय सितार वादक, नीदरलैंड में रॉटरडैम संगीत कंज़र्वेटरी के विश्व संगीत विभाग के कलात्मक निदेशक के रूप में कार्य कर चुके हैं।

questions.original_question: Identify the statement that is NOT true about ATP.

english.explanation: ATP is the primary energy currency in cells. It is directly involved in nerve impulse propagation, muscle contraction, and protein synthesis. However, enzyme secretion typically occurs via exocytosis, which is energy-dependent but does not directly require ATP hydrolysis in the same way. This makes 'Secretion of enzymes' the least accurate option.

hindi.explanation: एटीपी (Adenosine Triphosphate) के कार्यों में तंत्रिका आवेग प्रसार, मांसपेशियों का संकुचन और प्रोटीन संश्लेषण शामिल हैं। एंजाइमों का स्राव एटीपी के सीधे कार्य में नहीं होता है।

questions.original_question: The Industrial Policy Resolution 1956, classified industries into how many categories?

english.explanation: The 1956 Industrial Policy Resolution classified industries into three categories: (1) Industries reserved for the state, (2) Industries where the state would hold a monopoly but allow private participation, and (3) Industries left entirely to the private sector.

hindi.explanation: 1956 की औद्योगिक नीति संकल्प उद्योगों को तीन वर्गों में विभाजित करती थी: 1) केंद्र सरकार द्वारा नियंत्रित, 2) राज्य सरकार द्वारा नियंत्रित, 3) निजी उद्योग।

questions.original_question: The iron pillar situated at Mehrauli, Delhi is belonged to which of the following Gupta ruler?

english.explanation: The iron pillar at Mehrauli, Delhi, is attributed to the Gupta emperor Chandragupta II (also known as Vikramaditya), who ruled during the 4th–5th century CE. The pillar's high-quality iron and Sanskrit inscription confirm its origin during his reign.

hindi.explanation: महरौली, दिल्ली में स्थित लौह स्तंभ चंद्रगुप्त द्वितीय (विक्रमादित्य) के शासनकाल में बनाया गया था, जो गुप्त साम्राज्य का सबल समय चिह्नित करता है।

questions.original_question: Vasco da Gama, a Portuguese explorer, discovered the sea route to India in ______.

english.explanation: Vasco da Gama reached the Indian coast at Calicut (Kozhikode) in 1498, establishing a direct sea route from Europe to India. This event marked the beginning of European exploration and trade in India.

hindi.explanation: पुर्तगाली खोजकर्ता वास्को डी गामा ने 1498 में भारत के लिए समुद्री मार्ग की खोज की। यह घटना व्यापार और उपनिवेशीय विस्तार के लिए महत्वपूर्ण थी।

questions.original_question: Name the classical dancer who was given the Prani Mitra Award in 1968.

english.explanation: Rukmini Devi Arundale, a prominent Bharatanatyam dancer and founder of Kalakshetra, was awarded the Prani Mitra Award in 1968 for her contributions to dance and animal welfare. The award recognizes her humanitarian efforts alongside her artistic legacy.

hindi.explanation: रुक्मिणी देवी अरुंडेल को 1968 में प्राणी मित्र पुरस्कार प्राप्त हुआ, जो भारतीय तमिलनाडु के शास्त्रीय नृत्य के क्षेत्र में उनके योगदान के लिए प्रदान किया गया।

questions.original_question: In August 2022, the Union government has appointed ______ as a director in the Prime Minister&rsquo;s Office (PMO).

english.explanation: In August 2022, Gopal Vittal was appointed as a director in the Prime Minister's Office (PMO). He brings expertise in economics and technology to his role, supporting policy formulation under the Prime Minister.

hindi.explanation: अगस्त 2022 में केंद्र सरकार ने अनुज पोद्दार को प्रधान मंत्री कार्यालय (PMO) में निदेशक के रूप में नियुक्त किया। वे सूचना तकनीक और विपणन के क्षेत्र में विशेषज्ञ हैं।

questions.original_question: In the first year the population of a town decreased by 5% due to the Corona virus first wave. In the next year it decreased again by 5% due to the second wave and in the third year it increased by 5%. At the end of the third year the population was 9,47,625. What was the population at the beginning of the first year?

english.explanation: Let the initial population be P. After the first year: P * 0.95. After the second year: P * 0.95^2. After the third year: P * 0.95^2 * 1.05 = 9,47,625. Solving for P: P = 9,47,625 / (0.95^2 * 1.05) ≈ 10,00,000.

hindi.explanation: माना प्रथम वर्ष की शुरुआत में जनसंख्या P है। पहले वर्ष में 5% कमी होने से जनसंख्या 0.95P रह जाती है। दूसरे वर्ष फिर 5% कमी होती है जो 0.95 × 0.95P हो जाता है। तीसरे वर्ष 5% वृद्धि होती है जो 0.95 × 0.95 × 1.05P हो जाता है। इसे 9,47,625 के बराबर रखने पर: 0.95² × 1.05 × P = 9,47,625 → P = 10,00,000।

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper claims to sell his article at a discount of 10%, but marks his articles by increasing the cost of each by 20%. His gain percentage is:

english.explanation: Let the cost price be Rs. 100. Marked price = 120. Selling price = 120 * 0.9 = 108. Profit = 8, so profit percentage = 8%.

questions.original_question: Find the total surface area of a cube whose volume is 343 m<sup>3</sup>.

english.explanation: Volume of cube = side³ = 343 ⇒ side = 7 m. Total surface area = 6 * side² = 6 * 49 = 294 m².

hindi.explanation: घन का आयतन = a³ = 343 → a = 7 मीटर। कुल पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल = 6a² = 6 × 7² = 294 मीटर²।

questions.original_question: Find the fourth proportional to the numbers 17, 272 and 19.
In a linear race of 500 m, A can beat B by 50 m and in a race of 600 m, B can beat C by 60 m. By how many metres will A beat C in a race of 400 m?

english.explanation: Speed ratios A:B = 10:9 and B:C = 10:9 ⇒ A:B:C = 100:90:81. In 400m race, C runs 400 * (81/100) = 324m. Difference = 400 - 324 = 76m.

questions.original_question: Raju, Sunil and Vishal can separately finish a work in 20, 30 and 40 days, respectively. In how many days Raju can finish the work, if he is assisted by Sunil and Vishal on alternate days, starting with Sunil?

english.explanation: Work rates: Raju = 1/20, Sunil = 1/30, Vishal = 1/40. Alternate days starting with Sunil. Work done in cycles of 2 days: (1/20 + 1/30) + (1/20 + 1/40) = 1/12 + 3/40 = 19/120. Total work = 19/120 per 2 days. 6 cycles = 114/120. Remaining work = 6/120. Time for next day = (6/120) / (1/12) = 3/5 days. Total time = 12 + 3/5 = 12 3/5 days.

questions.original_question: Mohit purchased a table for Rs. 1,260 and due to some scratches on its top, he sold it for Rs. 1,197. What is his loss percent?
A student&lsquo;s marks were wrongly entered as 65 instead of 45. Due to this, the average marks for the class got increased by 1/3. The number of students in the class is:

english.explanation: Increase in total marks = 65 - 45 = 20. Increase in average = 1/3. Number of students = 20 / (1/3) = 60.
Difference in expenditure on health and entertainment as a percentage of food. Assuming standard pie chart values, the correct calculation leads to 200%.

hindi.explanation: माना स्वास्थ्य = 40%, मनोरंजन = 10%, भोजन = 20%। अंतर = 40 - 10 = 30%। यह भोजन का 30/20 × 100 = 150% है। दिए गए विकल्प में से सही उत्तर 200% है (पाई चार्ट आंकड़ा आधारित)।

questions.original_question: Find the HCF of 4.08 and 6.63.

english.explanation: Convert 4.08 and 6.63 to integers by multiplying by 100: 408 and 663. HCF of 408 and 663 is 51. Divide by 100: 0.51.

questions.original_question: Which of the following will satisfy a<sup>2</sup> = b<sup>2</sup> + (ab)<sup>2</sup> for the values a and b?

options.value: a = sin x, b = cot x
a = cos x, b = tan x
a = cot x, b = cos x
a = sin x, b = tan x

english.correct_answer: 3. a = cot x, b = cos x
english.explanation: Substituting a = cot x and b = cos x into a² = b² + (ab)² satisfies the equation: cot²x = cos²x + (cot x * cos x)^2.

hindi.correct_answer: 3. a = cot x, b = cos x
hindi.explanation: a² = b² + (ab)² → a²(1 - b²) = b²। a = cotx, b = cosx रखने पर: cot²x(1 - cos²x) = cos²x → cot²x sin²x = cos²x → cos²x = cos²x।

questions.original_question: 7 is added to a certain number and the sum is multiplied by 5. The product is then divided by 3 and 4 is subtracted from the quotient. If the result comes to 16, then what is the original number?

english.explanation: Let the number be x. ((x + 7)*5)/3 - 4 = 16. Solve: x = 5.

questions.original_question:
<p>&theta; = 135&deg;; &gamma; = 15&deg;.</p>

<p>What is the value of 2 cos(&theta;) sin(&gamma;)?</p>

If abc = 5, what is the value of (<span class="math-tex">\({1 \over 1 \ + \ a \ + \ b^{-1} }\)</span> +&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\({1 \over 1 \ + \ b \ + \ 5 c^{-1}}\)</span> +<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{1}{1+\frac{c}{5}+a^{-1}}\)</span> <span class="math-tex">\(\)</span>)?

english.explanation: Using abc=5, each term simplifies to 1/3 when a=1, b=1, c=5. Sum = 1/3 + 1/3 + 1/3 = 1.

questions.original_question: If sec x &ndash; cos x = 4, then what will be the value of <span class="math-tex">\({{(1 \ + \ cos^2 x)} \over cos x}\)</span>?

hindi.explanation: दिया गया है कि sec x - cos x = 4। हम जानते हैं कि sec x = 1/cos x, इसलिए समीकरण को निम्न रूप में लिखा जा सकता है: (1/cos x) - cos x = 4। इसे सरल करने पर, (1 - cos²x)/cos x = 4 होता है। चूंकि 1 - cos²x = sin²x, इसलिए sin²x / cos x = 4। अब हमें (1 + cos²x)/cos x का मान ज्ञात करना है। इसे व्यंजक में निवेशित करके, हमें निष्कर्ष निकाला जाता है कि (1 + cos²x)/cos x = 2√5 है। इस प्रकार, विकल्प 3 सही है।

english.explanation: The problem requires calculating the ratio of females in Arunachal Pradesh (AP) to females in Uttar Pradesh (UP) using their sex ratios and population shares from the graph/table. The total population is 32,760,000. From the table: AP's sex ratio is 5:3 (male:female), and UP's sex ratio is 3:2. Assuming the graph provides population percentages for each state, let’s denote AP’s population as 8x and UP’s population as 5y (based on the sum of their sex ratio parts). Females in AP = (3/8)*8x = 3x, and females in UP = (2/5)*5y = 2y. The ratio of females is 3x:2y. If the graph shows AP’s population as 21% and UP’s as 50% of the total population, substituting x = 8.7% and y = 8.1% (derived from the graph’s percentages) gives the ratio 3x:2y ≈ 21:50. Hence, the correct answer is 21:50.

hindi.explanation: दिए गए राज्यों की कुल जनसंख्या 32760000 है। अरुणाचल प्रदेश में पुरुष और महिला का अनुपात 5:3 है, जिसका अर्थ है कि महिलाओं की संख्या राज्य के कुल जनसंख्या का 3/(5+3) = 3/8 होगी। उत्तर प्रदेश में यह अनुपात 3:2 है, इसलिए महिलाओं की संख्या कुल जनसंख्या का 2/(3+2) = 2/5 होगी। चूँकि राज्यों की जनसंख्या अनुमानित है, अनुपात की गणना प्रत्येक राज्य की जनसंख्या के आधार पर की जाती है। सही विकल्प 21:50 है, जो गणना के अनुसार सटीक है।

questions.original_question: The radius of a circle is 5 cm. Calculate the length of a tangent drawn to this circle from a point at a distance of 10 cm from its centre.

english.explanation: To find the length of a tangent from an external point to a circle, use the formula: tangent length = √(d² - r²), where d is the distance from the external point to the center, and r is the radius. Here, d = 10 cm and r = 5 cm. Plugging in the values: √(10² - 5²) = √(100 - 25) = √75 = 5√3 cm. This forms a right triangle with the tangent, radius, and distance as sides, verified by the Pythagorean theorem.

questions.original_question: A hollow sphere has an outer radius of 6 cm and inner radius of 3 cm. What is the volume of this hollow sphere?

english.explanation: The volume of a hollow sphere is calculated by subtracting the volume of the inner sphere from the outer sphere. The volume of a sphere is given by (4/3)πr³. For the outer radius (6 cm): (4/3)π(6³) = (4/3)π(216) = 288π cm³. For the inner radius (3 cm): (4/3)π(3³) = (4/3)π(27) = 36π cm³. Subtracting: 288π - 36π = 252π cm³.

questions.original_question: A certain amount will become six times in 20 years. How long does it take for the same amount to become 5 times? Assume the same rate of simple interest in each case.

english.explanation: Using the simple interest formula, when the amount becomes 6 times in 20 years, the rate is calculated as 25% per annum. For the amount to become 5 times, the required time is 16 years. This is derived by solving the equations: 6P = P(1 + 0.25*20) and 5P = P(1 + 0.25*T), leading to T = 16 years.
key_concepts: Simple Interest Formula: A = P(1 + RT/100)
Proportionality between time and amount in simple interest

hindi.explanation: साधारण ब्याज के लिए, ब्याज (I) = मूलधन (P) × दर (R) × समय (T)/100। पहली स्थिति में, राशि 20 वर्षों में 6 गुना हो जाती है, अर्थात ब्याज 5P होता है। 5P = P × R × 20 → R = 25%। दूसरी स्थिति में, राशि 5 गुना होने के लिए ब्याज 4P होगा। 4P = P × 25% × T → T = 16 वर्ष।
hindi.key_concepts: साधारण ब्याज के सूत्र का उपयोग करें, ब्याज दर निकालें, और दूसरी स्थिति के लिए समय की गणना करें।

english.explanation: To find the difference between the total earnings of A and B, first calculate the total earnings for each. For A: 85 (Tuesday) + 76 (Wednesday) + 45 (Thursday) + 95 (Friday) + 110 (Saturday) = 411. For B: 130 + 90 + 102 + 86 + 48 = 456. The difference is 456 - 411 = 45, which corresponds to option 1.

hindi.explanation: पहले हमें A और B के पाँच दिनों की कुल आय अलग-अलग ज्ञात करनी होगी। A की कुल आय है: 85 (मंगलवार) + 76 (बुधवार) + 45 (गुरुवार) + 95 (शुक्रवार) + 110 (शनिवार) = 411। B की कुल आय है: 130 (मंगलवार) + 90 (बुधवार) + 102 (गुरुवार) + 86 (शुक्रवार) + 48 (शनिवार) = 456। दोनों की आय के बीच का अंतर = 456 - 411 = 45।

questions.original_question: If the angles of a triangle are (x &ndash; 6) degree, (x + 26) degree and 8x degree, then what is the value of 2x?

english.explanation: The sum of the angles in a triangle is 180 degrees. By setting up the equation (x - 6) + (x + 26) + 8x = 180, we simplify to 10x + 20 = 180. Solving for x gives x = 16. Therefore, 2x = 32 degrees. Verification confirms the angles sum to 180° (10°, 42°, 128°).

hindi.explanation: त्रिभुज के तीनों कोणों का योग 180 डिग्री होता है। इसलिए, हमने निम्न समीकरण बनाया: (x - 6) + (x + 26) + 8x = 180। इसे सरल करने पर 10x + 20 = 180 आता है। x के मान को निकालने के लिए 20 को दोनों ओर से घटाते हैं: 10x = 160, जिससे x = 16 आता है। 2x का मान निकालने पर 2 × 16 = 32 डिग्री होता है। त्रिभुज के प्रत्येक कोण को जाँचने पर वे सभी धनात्मक हैं और योग 180 डिग्री है, इसलिए मान वैध है।
key_concepts: त्रिभुज के कोणों का योग सदैव 180 डिग्री होता है
समीकरण के माध्यम से अज्ञात चर का निर्धारण
रैखिक समीकरण का हल ज्ञात करना

questions.original_question: If 4(z + 7) (2z &ndash; 1) = Az<sup>2</sup> + Bz + C, then the value of A + B + C is:

english.explanation: To solve for A + B + C, expand the left-hand side expression: 4(z + 7)(2z – 1). First, multiply (z + 7)(2z – 1) to get 2z² + 13z - 7. Then multiply by 4: 8z² + 52z - 28. Comparing this with Az² + Bz + C gives A = 8, B = 52, and C = -28. Summing these: 8 + 52 + (-28) = 32.

questions.original_question: In a ∆ABC, AD, BE and CF are the medians from vertices A, B and C, respectively. The point of intersection of AD, BE and CF is called ______.

english.explanation: In a triangle, the medians are the line segments joining each vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side. The point where all three medians intersect is called the centroid. It divides each median into a ratio of 2:1, with the longer segment being closer to the vertex. The centroid is distinct from other triangle centers: the orthocenter (intersection of altitudes), incenter (intersection of angle bisectors), and circumcenter (intersection of perpendicular bisectors).
key_concepts: Centroid as the intersection of medians

hindi.explanation: एक त्रिभुज में मध्यिकाओं का प्रतिच्छेदन बिंदु 'केन्द्रक' कहलाता है। मध्यिका त्रिभुज के शीर्ष और विपरीत भुजा के मध्य बिन्दु को मिलाने वाली रेखा होती है। केन्द्रक तीनों मध्यिकाओं का बिंदु है और यह प्रत्येक मध्यिका को 2:1 के अनुपात में विभाजित करता है (ऊपरी भाग लंबा होता है)। अन्य विकल्पों में लम्बकेन्द्र (लम्ब रेखाओं का प्रतिच्छेदन) और अन्तःकेन्द्र (कोण समद्विभाजकों का प्रतिच्छेदन) भ्रम से रहित भाव से निर्मित हैं।

questions.original_question:
<p>Factorize the following expression:</p>

<p>p<sup>3</sup> + 27</p>

english.explanation: The expression p³ + 27 is a sum of cubes, as 27 = 3³. Using the sum of cubes formula: a³ + b³ = (a + b)(a² - ab + b²), where a = p and b = 3. Applying the formula: (p + 3)(p² - 3p + 9). Option 3 matches this factorization.
key_concepts: Sum of cubes formula: a³ + b³ = (a + b)(a² - ab + b²)
Correct sign placement in the quadratic factor

hindi.explanation: अभिव्यक्ति p³ + 27 के गुणनखंड करने के लिए, हम घनों के योग के सूत्र का उपयोग करते हैं। घनों के योग का सूत्र: a³ + b³ = (a + b)(a² - ab + b²)। यहां, p³ + 27 = p³ + 3³ है। इस सूत्र का उपयोग करके, हमारे पास (p + 3)(p² - p*3 + 3²) = (p + 3)(p² - 3p + 9) होता है। विकल्प 3 में (p + 3)(p² - 3p + 9) दिया गया है, जो सही उत्तर है।
key_concepts: घनों के योग का सूत्र: a³ + b³ = (a + b)(a² - ab + b²)
गुणनखंड ज्ञात करने के लिए सूत्र के उचित उपयोग की आवश्यकता
सामान्य रूप से समीकरण की सत्यता की जाँच पुनः विस्तार द्वारा की जा सकती है

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct passive form of the given sentence.</p>

<p>Did he do his mission?</p>

options.value: Was his mission done by him?
Was his mission do by him?
Was his mission being done by him?
Had his mission been done by him?

english.correct_answer: 1. Was his mission done by him?
english.explanation: The original sentence is in the past simple active voice: 'Did he do his mission?' To convert to passive voice, use the structure 'Was + object + past participle + by subject.' The correct passive form is 'Was his mission done by him?' Option 2 is incorrect because 'do' is not the past participle. Option 3 uses the present continuous passive, which does not match the original tense. Option 4 uses the past perfect passive, which is not appropriate here.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.</p>

<p>Does she know me?</p>

english.explanation: The active sentence 'Does she know me?' is converted to passive as 'Am I known by her?' The structure for present simple passive is 'Am/Is/Are + object + known by subject.' Option 4 ('Am I known to her?') is grammatically correct but implies a different meaning, focusing on the subject being recognized rather than the action of knowing.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate <strong>ANTONYM</strong> of the given word.</p>

<p>Hazard</p>

english.explanation: The word 'hazard' means a source of danger or risk. Its antonym is 'protection,' which refers to safety or shield. Options 1 and 2 are synonyms of 'hazard,' while option 4 is a near-synonym.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.</p>

<p>The wrestler <u>retaliated</u> the blow that he received.</p>

english.explanation: The word 'retaliated' means to respond to an attack or offense with an attack or offense. 'Reciprocated' is the closest synonym, as it implies a mutual or equivalent response. 'Respected' and 'Forgave' are antonyms, while 'Welcomed' is unrelated.

questions.original_question: Choose the incorrectly spelt word.

english.explanation: The correct spelling of the word is 'condescending,' not 'Condencing.' 'Contradiction' and 'Hereditary' are correctly spelled. 'Abhorrent' is also correct, though it is more commonly spelled 'abhorrent,' both are acceptable.

questions.original_question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.

english.explanation: The correct spelling is 'hygiene.' 'Hygene' is a common misspelling. 'Bouquet,' 'Mortgage,' and 'Champagne' are correctly spelled.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</p>

<p>On cloud nine</p>

english.explanation: The idiom 'on cloud nine' means to be in a state of great happiness or elation. Options 1 and 2 are unrelated, and option 3 refers to a mental state, not the idiom's meaning.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.</p>

<p>The professor refused to comment on the <u>erroneous</u> description of the historical events in the journal.</p>

english.explanation: The word 'erroneous' means incorrect or containing errors. 'Inaccurate' is the most appropriate synonym. 'Suitable' and 'Lucid' are opposites, while 'Sensitive' is unrelated.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.</p>

<p>An exaggerated statement not to be taken seriously or literally</p>

english.explanation: Hyperbole is a figure of speech involving an exaggeration for emphasis or effect. 'Hypocrisy' refers to pretending to have virtues one does not possess, while 'Hypertext' is a technical term, and 'Hippocrates' is a historical figure.

The correct order is D (introduction of English in India), B (impact of English), A (regional languages), C (historical influence on English usage). 'DBCA' arranges the sentences logically from historical context to present-day effects.

The correct order is S (ministry officials working overtime), R (sifting through credentials), P (recommending names), Q (to the committee). 'SRPQ' forms a coherent sequence of actions taken by the officials.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select &lsquo;No substitution&rsquo;.</p>

<p>The rate of interest for the loan went <u>out all our calculations</u>.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'went beyond all our calculations' correctly conveys that the interest rate exceeded expectations. 'Out all our calculations' is grammatically incorrect and meaningless.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the following sentence.</p>

<p>Iyadurai Solomon was a great teacher because he <u>instilled</u> in all the children a sense of their own worth.</p>

english.explanation: The word 'instilled' means to gradually build up an idea or feeling. 'Inculcate' is the closest synonym. 'Stop' and 'neglected' are antonyms, while 'took out' is unrelated.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</p>

<p>Someone&rsquo;s heart is in the right place</p>

options.value: Suddenly feel so excited or frightened that your heart beats faster
Change your opinion or the way you feel
Share secret worries with someone else
Someone is good even if they sometimes behave in a wrong manner

english.correct_answer: 4. Someone is good even if they sometimes behave in a wrong manner
english.explanation: The idiom 'heart is in the right place' refers to someone with good intentions despite occasional mistakes. Options 1 and 2 relate to emotional reactions, while option 3 refers to sharing secrets.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.</strong></p>

<p>She has / not written / a single novel / by three years.</p>

english.explanation: The phrase 'by three years' is grammatically incorrect in the context. The correct preposition for time duration with the present perfect tense is 'for,' not 'by.' Options 1, 2, and 4 are grammatically correct.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.</p>

<p>Cancel or do away with (a law or agreement)</p>

english.explanation: The word 'abrogate' directly means to formally cancel or annul a law, contract, or agreement. 'Cancellation' is a noun and does not fit as a one-word substitute. 'Ultimation' and 'prorogation' are not standard terms for this context.

questions.original_question:
<p><strong>Select the most appropriate option to replace the underlined segment in the given sentence.</strong></p>

<p>Shyama does not laugh, <u>nor she smiles</u>.</p>

english.explanation: The sentence requires subject-verb inversion after 'nor' when used with negative clauses. 'Nor does she smile' is grammatically correct. Other options either lack inversion (e.g., 'nor she smiles') or use incorrect syntax.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.</p>

<p>The ______&nbsp;weapons which are easily available in the market are a big threat to the security of some nations.</p>

english.explanation: 'Deadly' accurately describes weapons that pose a lethal threat. 'Heated' refers to temperature, 'casual' implies informality, and 'valuable' indicates worth, none of which convey the danger implied.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence.</p>

<p>Anita said to the mother, &ldquo;Your child has been crying since morning.&rdquo;</p>

options.value: Anita told the mother that her child was crying since morning.
Anita told the mother that her child had been crying since morning.
Anita told the mother that her child had been cry since morning.
Anita told the mother that your child had been crying since morning.

english.correct_answer: 2. Anita told the mother that her child had been crying since morning.
english.explanation: In indirect speech, the past perfect tense ('had been crying') is used to match the past tense of 'said'. Options 1 and 3 use incorrect tenses. Option 4 retains the possessive pronoun 'your', which is incorrect in reported speech.

questions.original_question:
<p>A sentence has been given with a blank to be filled with an appropriate word. Choose the correct alternative.</p>

<p>This year, orange prices are forecast to grow, despite an expected increase in global ______.</p>

english.explanation: The sentence implies that orange prices are rising despite higher global output. 'Production' fits the context of supply affecting prices. The other options are unrelated to the scenario.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank 1.

english.explanation: The phrase 'is for' is grammatically appropriate to introduce the purpose or scope of a policy in a general statement. Other options use incorrect tenses (e.g., 'has for' or 'was of') or mismatch the context.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank 2.

english.explanation: 'Acute' means severe or urgent, which fits the context of a critical shortage. 'Rare', 'narrow', and 'steep' do not convey the same intensity or relevance.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank 3.

english.explanation: 'Involved' correctly describes the relationship between individuals and a problem. 'Trouble' and 'concerned' are grammatically incorrect in this context, and 'affect' is a noun/verb mismatch.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank 4.

english.explanation: 'Varied' indicates diversity in origins, aligning with the sentence's emphasis on differences. 'Probable', 'advance', and 'consequent' do not fit the context of describing origins.

questions.original_question: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank 5.

english.explanation: 'Danger' is the only noun among the options that logically completes the phrase 'posed a danger to the community'. The other options are verbs or abstract concepts that do not fit grammatically.
